alert.note: Alert for Lanai Leeward; Lanai Mauka; Lanai South; Lanai Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Leeward South; Molokai North; Molokai Southeast; Molokai West; Molokai Windward (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 12:07AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lanai, Maui and Molokai in Maui County through 130 AM HST... At 1205 AM HST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers and a few thunderstorms along a line extending from 22 miles south of Hawaii Kai to near Lanai City. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kahului, Lahaina, Lanai City, Hoolehua, Honokohau, Kahakuloa, Wailuku, Kualapuu, Maunaloa, Waihee, Kapalua, Puunene, Kalaupapa National Park, Waikapu, Halawa Valley, Kaunakakai, Waiehu, Kawela, Kepuhi and Napili-Honokowai. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
